sources.autograph: Berlin, Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, M.575, 'Quartetto Vº....' (for title, see No. 201)
ms_copies_parts: Berlin, Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, M.577 and M.578. Two copies made in Berlin for Frederick William II.
Prague, Národní Muzeum, XXII. B.63, 'Quartetto no. 29...'
Rome, Accademia Santa Cecilia, G. MSS. 357 to 360, dated 1792.
sources.first_edition: (c. 1782), Vienna, Artaria: Op. 33 no. 5 (for title, see No. 201)
later_editions: (c. 1782/1783), London, Kerpen: Op. 33 no. 5 (for title, see No. 201)
1785, Paris, Sieber: Op. 33 no. 5 (for title, see No. 201)
1798, Paris, Pleyel: Op. 39 no. 11 (Book 4 no. 2; for title, see No. 234)

entries.notes: With a written cadenza for the first violin entitled 'Capriccio ad libitum'. Trio section marked 'dolciss. e smorzoso'

partial_notes: This appears to be part of a series of string quartets by Casermetta S. Colombano - Lucca
